body_html:
I don't see why DNNClassifier should free up resources when it goes out of scope. Python does not have variable scopes like c++. To me, this looks like it is working as intended. @xiejw what do you think?

Why do you need to create a new DNNClassifier in every iteration? Can't you just have one and keep training.

I don't see why DNNClassifier should free up resources when it goes out of scope. Python does not have variable scopes like c++. To me, this looks like it is working as intended. @xiejw what do you think?
Why do you need to create a new DNNClassifier in every iteration? Can't you just have one and keep training.
body:
I don't see why DNNClassifier should free up resources when it goes out of scope. Python does not have variable scopes like c++. To me, this looks like it is working as intended. @xiejw what do you think?

Why do you need to create a new DNNClassifier in every iteration? Can't you just have one and keep training.
